class_notes:
This course will be taught online. It meets for two synchronous 75-minute sessions per week on MW.
This course satisfies the new Religion major requirement:- Tradition-Christianity, Theme.  
An intellectually driven exploration of death and dying that is basically divided into four parts: theory and method; cross-cultural study of attitudes; death in western Christian history; death in America. We cover a lot of ground, for sure, but we will also be keeping one foot in the present, and think about death in the world we are living in, particularly as it relates to the pandemics of COVID-19 and racism, but also to popular cultures and cultural obsessions.
course_description: Understanding death through a study of religious attitudes and practices, modern therapies for the dying, ethical issues, and Western and Asian theological perspectives.
